value: The Thatched Cottage on the Hill

label: Description
value: Landscape with trees at left; a river in right foreground. A thatched cottage visible at left; another cottage over the river at right. In mid-distance, a church; clouds and three birds in the sky. Inscribed: left center: "Ruisdael."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
The Dance In Front of An Inn

label: Description
value: In front of an old house, at left, a couple are dancing. A musician who plays a clarinet, stands behind them. Several onlookers surround them in semi-circle. Houses in background with a group of peasants standing in front of one of them. Inscribed, lower margin: "Nu is't de reghte tydt... kekmisis"; lower left: "Joan de Vischer fecit"; lower center: "Ad. van Ostade pinxit"; lower right: "Nicolaus Visscher execudit".

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Cardinal Emmanuel-Théodore de la Tour-d'Auvergne, duc d'Abret (1644-1715)

label: Description
value: Bust length portrait, turned toward the left, the head shown in three-quarter view, looking out at the spectator. Enclosed in oval frame. Coat of arms in escutcheon below. At lower left: "N. Mignard pinxit." At lower right: "Ant. Masson sculpebat 1665." Inscribed in frame: "EMMANVEL THEODOSIVS DE LA TOUR DAVVERGNE DVX DALBRET.."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: St. Gregory faces frontally, at the right, with his arm about St. Basil's shoulders. St. Basil is turned slightly to the right, and is pointing at St. Gregory. Both hold scrolls inscribed in Greek. Below, the title: "S. Basilius Magnus et S. Gregorius Nazianzenus", an inscription, and the artists' names.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Three-quarter length portrait of the architect, seated, turned slightly to the right, facing the spectator. His left hand is gloved and holds the glove for his right hand. Title and arms below, followed by publisher's address. Signed in plate below frame: "Edelinck Egues Sculpsit."
Portrait of Jean Paul Bignon, Abbé of St. Quentin

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of a man, facing the spectator, the head turned toward the left. Enclosed in an oval frame, on a pedestal. Arms below in a cartouche. Title in frame. At lower left: "Hycinthus Rigaud pinxit"; at lower right: "Petr. Drevet Sculptsit."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Madame Lambert (Marie de Laubespine)

label: Description
value: Almost full length portrait of the young woman seated in an armchair. In three-quarter view to right. Dress has a décolleté neckline surrounded by lac. A part of the fur from her coat is over her right shoulder. She holds a dog in her lap. In background, columns, and a wall with pilasters. Inscribed, lower left: "N. Largilliere pinxit"; lower right: "P. Drevet Sculpt."; lower margin: "Marie de Laubespine, femme de Nicolas Lambert; / Seign^r. de Thorigny, President en la Chambre des Comptes. / A Paris chez P. Drevet rüe de Foin devant les Mathurins."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Saint Mary kneeling at the left, the angel kneeling on a cloud at the right, with the lily. Above, five putti with joined hands, circling above the dove in the rays of light. Below, the artist's names. Top right corner: "22".

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Prà della Valle (Prato della Valle, Padua), from the Vedute altre prese da i luoghi altre ideate

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
A View of a Town with a Bishop's Tomb

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Cardinal Jaques Benigne Bossuet (1627-1704)

label: Description
value: Full-length portrait of the prelate, standing, facing the spectator, his head turned toward the left. His right hand rests on a book, his left holds his hat. He wears the robes of his office. Title and arms in margin below. Signed and dated below frame, lower right.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Three-quarter length portrait of the prelate, seated, turned toward the right, looking out at the spectator. He wears the robes of his office. Title and arms in margin below. Signed and dated in frame, lower right.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The body of Christ, center, is carried toward the tomb in the hillside, right. His Mother, who has fainted, is seen in foreground, left. A woman, right, holds a jar bearing the inscription: "J.B. Jackson/Delin Sculp and / excudit 1739." Inscription in margin below: "Insignam hanc Tabulam Jacobo de Ponte depictam..."

label: Physical description
value: Chiaroscuro woodcut from four blocks, in buff, light reddish tan, gray, dark brown inks

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The saint is shown full-length, facing the spectator, his figure turned slightly to the right. He is bound to the column, his hands tied behind his back. Four arrows have pierced his body. The monogram of the artist appears on a paper which is attached to a stone shaft, lower left.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Presentation of the Virgin in the Temple, after Titian (right sheet)

label: Description
value: Detail of the painted composition, the young Virgin ascends a flight of steps toward the priest and his attendants. Beside the wall of the steps, lower left, a basket of eggs and a seated woman, only partially shown. The raised arm of a man is visibl behind the figures of Mary. At lower right a coat of arms, rampant lion, on an escutcheon, followed by six line dedication signed: "J.B. Jackson."

label: Physical description
value: Chioroscuro woodcut from four blocks, in light grayish umber, medium brown, dark gray, dark brown.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Self-Portrait of Maurice-Quentin de La Tour

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of the artist, turned toward the left, looking out at the spectator. Enclosed in the architectural enframement of a window, his left arm rests on the sill, the hand pointed to the left. Inscription below, in frame: "Peint par De La Tour/et Gravé/Par son ami Schmidt/en 1742." Address in margin below.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A half-length portrait of a warrior in frontal view; the body turned slightly to right, head to left. The warrior has a short beard; he wears a cap with a fur border with a pin attached in front and a feather in back. Inscribed, right center: "Schmidt fec."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
The Father of the Jewish Bride

label: Description
value: An old bearded man in frontal view, slightly turned to right. Inscribed, lower left: "Rembrandt pinx 1641"; lower center: "Le Pere de la fiancée reglant sa dot, d'aprés le tableau original de Rembrandt tiré du Cabinet e Monsieur le Comte de Kameke"; lower right: "G. F. Schmidt fec. acqua - for. 1770."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Samson, with his sword at his left, his left hand an upraised fist, long hair and a beard, speaks to his father-in-law, whose head is in an open window at the left. (This version is without the two African figures in the painting.) The artists' names and date below.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The old Tobias sits on a bench on the porch, his foot on a rest-warmer, a dog asleep at his feet. His wife, with knitting in her hands and lap, leans toward him. A goat, right, beyond a chateau-like building. Below, the title: "Der alte Tobias wird von Seinen Weibe Verspottet"; the artists' names and date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A stream running below a huge gnarled tree blown by the wind. Three people attempting to run to the right are blown back. A house and more trees beyond. Below, "Geo. Jn^o Smith Chichester 1767" and right, an initial.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The nurse sits under a tree in the corner of the garden, with an infant on her lap. Around her, a barrel, wrapping or cloak, a broom, basket, hand harrow. Below, the artist's name and date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Countryside, a man and woman seated at the left. They are about to eat some grapes. Hills beyond. Below, the artist's name and the date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The road winds along the bank of a stream to its right, with a cliff on the left. A town in the background. Three people on the road, with a basket in front of them. A man, woman, and girl. Below, the artist's initials and the date.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Portrait of Field Marshal Count Waldemar de Loewendal (1700-1755)

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of a man, facing the spectator. Enclosed in wide oval frame. Arms and title below. Signed and dated in margin, lower right: "Gravé par J. G. Will á Paris 1749;" lower center "Les orn. inv. par H. Gravelot."

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Set in an arched simulated stone frame is the half-length figure of the sitter, done from Rigaud's portrait of 1735. He is seen facing toward the right, head frontally, his right hand resting on a book.

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Four women before a curtain. The Child standing at the left, one woman (far left) supporting him, another, pointing to him with both hands. Below, the artist' names and place and date.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on beige paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Three Women, with a Boy Lying Down

label: Description
value: The boy lying on a table or bed before a curtain. One woman is moving his covering, two others, to the right, look on. Below, the artists' names and place and date.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on beige paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Virgin Mary, Joseph, and Child, with a Globe

label: Description
value: The Child sits at left with hsi back to a curtain and leans on the Globe. The Virgin at right, reaches out to him, with Joseph between and in back of them. Below, the artist' names and place of publication.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on beige paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Three Women with a Palette and Sketch of a Design

label: Description
value: The woman, center, wears a huge turban-like hat, her right hand holding brushes, and touching the palette, her left hand supporting the design of a woman in drapery. The two other women look on, at either side. Below the artists' names.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on beige paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum
Virgin, Infant, and Joseph with an Angel Playing on a Violin

label: Description
value: The Virgin seated, with the Infant in her arms, watches the Angel to her left, playing the violin. Joseph, left, faces them both. Two putti, upper left, look down. Below, the artists' names.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The larger boy, at right, gestures to the right while holding high in his left hand the ends of a covering about the second boy, who stands with his back to the observer, looking towards the left.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on beige paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Flora seated, center, facing right, a putti hands her a bouquet while she waves another in her left hand. Flowers and leaves in her hair.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
Virgin and Child Holding a Book

label: Description
value: The Child stands on a table at the left, His head turned toward His Mother. The Virgin stands behind Him, with Her hands supporting Him and the book.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum
A bishop saint pointing to a model city, with other figures, after a drawing by Guercino

label: Description
value: The old man, with a beard and heavy cloak st ands at left, pointing to the model of the town held by the boy. The woman, behind right, looks down, her cheek to her hand. The boy, center, has his back to the observer.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Ssaint John holds a bowl under a fountain, to the left. A cross of wood at the right, and mountains beyond.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Sophonisba sits at a table, in front of a curtain. The crown is on the table, far right; a bowl in both her hands, resting on the table. She looks slightly to the left.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A bearded man in armor stands, facing frontally, gazing to the right, a staff in his hands.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
value: George Campbell Cooper; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A woman sits at a table, her elbow on the table at left, resting on a book with "SIBILEA LIBIA" written on its spine. In her left hand she holds another book, open.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in brown ink on white paper

label: Provenance
